function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Use of mathematical equations without proper context","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of clarity in defining speed of recovery and performance levels","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Failure to account for environmental and human factors in resilience calculations","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear relationship between absorptive capacity and adaptive capacity","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty comprehending extreme values of the metric","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exponential growth function may not always represent system behavior","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Dependence on decision maker preferences for resilience values","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Probabilistic approach for assessing resilience","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Quality of service as a measure of resilience","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in quantification of resilience","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to consider extra penalty for performance loss and recovery time exceeding maximum acceptable values.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Incorporation of multiple hazards into the resilience measurement approach.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mischaracterization of restoration and resilience due to errors in estimating conditional probability by expert knowledge.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Resilience formula considers both pre-disaster and post-disaster activities, leading to a more suitable measurement for engineering systems.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The text discusses the implications of aging on system performance and resilience, which may be relevant in the context of contagious diseases that affect different age groups differently.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The resilience metric described in the text may not directly address the specific challenges posed by contagious diseases and their propagation in the built environment.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The text risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Stochastic nature of pd","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on dynamic simulation model for time-dependent risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective recovery activities defined","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on imprecise probabilities for
